children.subject: I was hoping to self-study the necessary multivariable calc for 189, do you think that's doable?
Not fully answering your question but you really need to have done multivariate calculus to take 189, so 53 should be on your todo list

170 is a heavy workload (homeworks are 10h+/week), 188 is not so heavy and very doable with 170. 61C is project heavy and also a lot of work. I'm not sure I would recommend 61C+170 if you want to get the most out of both classes (they are also most unrelated classes, 188 has a lot of graph theory overlap with 170), but depending on what kind of student you are it could work.
Aside question: How is taking 170 and 188 concurrently going? Thinking of taking that combo with 61c in the spring

history.content:
This really depends on your level of comfort with Linear Algebra, gradients, and probability; I took 189 without any of the above courses you're looking at (and got away with it, with considerable luck), but if I had to do it again, I would probably take 126 first (and possibly, but not necessarily 110).

126 is a very rigorous class in probability, that goes much more in depth than 70 and challenges you constantly - as a result, a lot of the probability you see in 189 will either be familiar or something you can get quickly acquainted to after taking 126. As Prof. Sahai has said on this Piazza before, 126 also helps build your 'mathematical muscles/maturity', so it's a good idea to take it before 189 so you're ready for 189.

110 is a good class to take, making you a lot more comfortable with Linear Algebra. That being said, it is also a lot more abstract than 54/16A/16B, and beyond the level of comfort, is unlikely to be very helpful in 189 - 189 focuses more on Matrix Calculus, SVDs, etc, topics that 110 does not cover/covers in very little detail, because 110 goes more into abstractions. 

110 does, however, increase your comfort with proofs significantly, so it can't hurt to take it before 189 - but if you're on a time crunch, it's by no means necessary. 

I've heard 127 can also help a lot with the optimization parts of 189; Data 100 goes over some of the basic concepts involved in 189, but at a less mathy level, and Stat 140 is the Stat department's version of 126, although I've heard 126 is a tougher class (and thus better prep for 189, although you might want to check in with someone who's taken 140 before enrolment).

Tldr; take 126 if you struggle with probability, if you don't just jump into 189 and work hard on concepts you don't know, you'll be fine.

children.subject: I did this combo last semester. It was very time consuming, but I learned a lot. They have been my two favorite classes so far, and I think every student thinking seriously about working in ML/optimization should take them. If you are debating between 126 and 127, 127 imo is more important, because at times 126 can feel like a regurgitation of 70.
What do you think is better prep for cs189? I was planning to either take 126 or 127 next semester, and then in fall 2018 take cs189 with the class I haven't taken.
Thanks for the follow-up! Is taking 126 and 127 together in the same semester advisable?

I plan on taking 170 next semester along with a probability course that is either Stat 134 or EE126. Does anyone have any advice on how manageable/useful these courses are? If 134 covers a substantial amount of material that's in 126, I'd prefer to take something that's easier.

history.content:
I am a junior LSCS + Cognitive Science double major that is trying to choose classes for the next few semesters. I have other CogSci requirements and am a research assistant in a neuroscience lab, so I would not want more than 2-3 techs a semester. I have taken EE16A and 54, but not 16B or 53. I'm currently in 170 and 188. Which of the following courses would be the best preparation for Machine Learning and also general statistics for Neuro/Psych research? 

Math 110

EE126

EE127

Data 100

Stat 140

I've read other Piazza posts on general 189 preparation but was wondering if anyone has any specific advice. Thanks!
history.subject: Best 189 Prep for LSCS + CogSci
